review: Works great, lots of choices. Very pleased with the choice.
author: Jean Burnand

review: I have both a roku sticj and the fire stick, the fire stick connects to the Internet faster than my roku.
author: sabrina Branch

review: The thing with Fire TV stick is you have to have a pretty healthy internet speed.  It worked great on our condo in FL with 15 meg, but back home, isn't watchable.  Which is odd, because Netflix works fine on the TV ap, but continually buffers on the stick.  It's not able to dumb-down resolution for slower speeds.
author: shopthefrontdoor

review: I do not like the fact that I pay for a subscription and still need to rent/purchases TV shows, Movies via Amazon Instant movies. I have the Fire TV Stick on one TV currently and it will be replaced with a ROKU. No subscriptions required to gain access and NETFLIX seems to be the best option I have seen so far. No extra charges required for their movie or TV library. Disappointed with the Amazon portion of streaming movies and TV.
author: Michael Manning
